titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Grace Mead Andrus de Laguna (1878-1978) was a professor of philosophy at Bryn Mawr College from 1907-1946, and was professor emeritus until her death in 1978. She was the wife of Theodore Lopez de Leo de Laguna and the mother of Frederica and Wallace de Laguna. She received her Ph.D. from Cornell University.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the professional and personal papers of Grade de Laguna. Professional materials include typescript and manuscript articles, reprints, and correspondence with fellow scholars, such as George Boas, Ernst Cassirer, Edward Sapir, Alfred North Whitehead. Personal papers include correspondence with Theodore de Laguna, correspondence with her parents from her sabbatical in Europe in 1914-1915, family histories, and biographical information.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Bryn Mawr College: Theodore de Laguna papers.
